intro: Dracaena zebra, commonly known as the zebra plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves that display alternating green and white stripes, resembling a zebra's coat. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear at the base of the leaves, followed by red berries. Dracaena zebra is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and ornamental purposes.
